metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: AngularJS Forms
Forms in AngularJS provides data-binding and validation of input controls.
content.html: Forms in AngularJS provides data-binding and validation of input controls.

content.text: Input Controls
Input controls are the HTML input elements:
content.html: Input controls are the HTML input elements:

content.text: Data-Binding
Input controls provides data-binding by using the ng-model directive.
content.html: Input controls provides data-binding by using the ng-model directive.

content.code_html: <input type="text" ng-model="firstname">

content.text: The application does now have a property named firstname .
content.html: The application does now have a property named firstname.

content.text: The ng-model directive binds the input controller to the rest of your application.
content.html: The ng-model directive binds the input controller to the rest of your application.

content.text: The property firstname , can be referred to in a controller:
content.html: The property firstname, can be referred to in a controller:

content.code_html:
<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('formCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.firstname = "John";
});
</script>

content.text: It can also be referred to elsewhere in the application:
content.html: It can also be referred to elsewhere in the application:

content.code_html:
<form>
  First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstname">
</form>

<h1>You entered: {{firstname}}</h1>

content.text: Checkbox
A checkbox has the value true or false . Apply the ng-model directive to a checkbox, and use its value in your application.
content.html: A checkbox has the value true or false. Apply the ng-model directive to a checkbox, and use its value in your application.

content.code:
Check to show a header:   

My Header
content.code_html:
<form>
  Check to show a header:
  <input type="checkbox" ng-model="myVar">
</form>

<h1 ng-show="myVar">My Header</h1>

content.text: Radiobuttons
Bind radio buttons to your application with the ng-model directive.
content.html: Bind radio buttons to your application with the ng-model directive.

content.text: Radio buttons with the same ng-model can have different values, but only the selected one will be used.
content.html: Radio buttons with the same ng-model can have different values, but only the selected one will be used.

content.code:
<form>
  Pick a topic:
  <input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" 
value="dogs">Dogs
  <input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" value="tuts">Tutorials


<input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" value="cars">Cars
</form>
content.code_html:
<form>
  Pick a topic:
  <input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" value="dogs">Dogs
  <input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" value="tuts">Tutorials
  <input type="radio" ng-model="myVar" value="cars">Cars
</form>

content.text: The value of myVar will be either dogs , tuts , or cars .
content.html: The value of myVar will be either dogs, tuts, or cars.

content.text: Selectbox
Bind select boxes to your application with the ng-model directive.
content.html: Bind select boxes to your application with the ng-model directive.

content.text: The property defined in the ng-model attribute will have the value of the selected option in the selectbox.
content.html: The property defined in the ng-model attribute will have the value of the selected option in the selectbox.

content.code:
<form>
  Select a topic:
  <select ng-model="myVar">
    
<option value="">
    <option value="dogs">Dogs
    
<option value="tuts">Tutorials
    <option 
value="cars">Cars
  </select>
</form>
content.code_html:
<form>
  Select a topic:
  <select ng-model="myVar">
    <option value="">
    <option value="dogs">Dogs
    <option value="tuts">Tutorials
    <option value="cars">Cars
  </select>
</form>

content.text: The value of myVar will be either dogs , tuts , or cars .
content.html: The value of myVar will be either dogs, tuts, or cars.

content.text: An AngularJS Form Example
form = {"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}
content.html: form = {"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}

content.text: master = {"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}
content.html: master = {"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe"}

content.text: Application Code

content.code:
First Name:
   
    Last Name:
   

     

form = {{{user}}

master = {{{master}}
content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="formCtrl">
  <form novalidate>
    First Name:<br>
    <input type="text" ng-model="user.firstName"><br>
    Last Name:<br>
    <input type="text" ng-model="user.lastName">
    <br><br>
    <button ng-click="reset()">RESET</button>
  </form>
  <p>form = {{{user}}</p>
  <p>master = {{{master}}</p>
</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('formCtrl', function($scope) {
  $scope.master = {firstName: "John", lastName: "Doe"};
  $scope.reset = function() {
    $scope.user = angular.copy($scope.master);
  };
  $scope.reset();
});
</script>

content.text: The novalidate attribute is new in HTML5. It disables any default browser validation.
content.html: The novalidate attribute is new in HTML5. It disables any default browser validation.

content.text: Example Explained
The ng-app directive defines the AngularJS application.
content.html: The ng-app directive defines the AngularJS application.

content.text: The ng-controller directive defines the application controller.
content.html: The ng-controller directive defines the application controller.

content.text: The ng-model directive binds two input elements to the user object in the model.
content.html: The ng-model directive binds two input elements to the user object in the model.

content.text: The formCtrl controller sets initial values to the master object, and defines the reset() method.
content.html: The formCtrl controller sets initial values to the master object, and defines the reset() method.

content.text: The reset() method sets the user object equal to the master object.
content.html: The reset() method sets the user object equal to the master object.

content.text: The ng-click directive invokes the reset() method, only if the button is clicked.
content.html: The ng-click directive invokes the reset() method, only if the button is clicked.

content.text: The novalidate attribute is not needed for this application, but normally you will use it in AngularJS forms, to override standard HTML5 validation.
content.html: The novalidate attribute is not needed for this application, but normally you will use it in AngularJS forms, to override standard HTML5 validation.
